metadata.title: CVE-2018-5178 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow was found during UTF8 to Unicode string conversion withinJavaScript with extremely large amounts of data. This vulnerabilityrequires the use of a malicious or vulnerable legacy extension in order tooccur. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird ESR < 52.8, Thunderbird <52.8, and Firefox ESR < 52.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
